question: [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [Type Safety] Can a malicious PrePartitioner implementation return mismatched vector lengths between ori_idxs_by_pre_partitioned, start_txn_idxs_by_shard, and pre_partitioned, causing out-of-bounds access or panics during execution that halt the validator? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [State Corruption] Can an implementation return duplicate OriginalTxnIdx values in the first return vector, causing the same transaction to be executed multiple times and leading to double-spending or state inconsistencies? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [Transaction Loss] Can a malicious implementation omit certain transaction indices from the returned vectors, causing transactions to be dropped silently without execution or validation, potentially losing user funds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [Integer Overflow] If ori_idxs_by_pre_partitioned contains indices >= state.num_txns(), can this cause integer overflow or out-of-bounds access when indexing into transaction arrays in subsequent processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [Determinism] Since PrePartitioner implementations must be deterministic across all validators, can non-deterministic behavior (e.g., HashMap iteration order) cause validators to partition blocks differently, leading to consensus failure and chain splits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [Shard Imbalance] Can a malicious implementation assign all transactions to a single shard in pre_partitioned, creating extreme load imbalance that degrades validator performance and causes liveness issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [Empty Shards] Can returning empty vectors for some shards in pre_partitioned cause null pointer exceptions or undefined behavior in downstream parallel execution logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitioner::pre_partition()] [Index Reordering] If start_txn_idxs_by_shard is not monotonically increasing, can this violate assumptions in the partition state and cause incorrect dependency tracking or transaction ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Function: default_pre_partitioner_config()] [Configuration Bypass] Can an attacker replace the default ConnectedComponentPartitionerConfig with a malicious config through configuration injection, causing incorrect partitioning behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Trait: PrePartitionerConfig::build()] [Type Confusion] Can a malicious build() implementation return a PrePartitioner that doesn't match the expected behavior, bypassing safety checks and causing execution inconsistencies across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Union-Find Manipulation] In the connected component partitioner's union-find algorithm, can integer overflow in num_senders + key_idx calculation cause incorrect merging of disjoint transaction sets, breaking conflict isolation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Group Size Attack] Can an attacker craft transactions to create a single massive connected component exceeding group_size_limit, causing the partitioner to create an unbounded number of groups and trigger OOM conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Division by Zero] If num_executor_shards is 0, will the group_size_limit calculation cause division by zero and panic the validator during block partitioning? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Float to Int Conversion] Can the ceil() conversion in group_size_limit calculation overflow usize on 32-bit systems when processing extremely large blocks, causing memory corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Atomic Ordering] Does the AtomicUsize::fetch_add in set_idx_counter use appropriate memory ordering to prevent race conditions in multi-threaded partition processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [VecDeque Underflow] When pop_front() is called on txns_by_set, can an accounting error cause more pops than pushes, leading to panic and validator crash during block processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Load Imbalance Tolerance] Can setting load_imbalance_tolerance to extreme values (e.g., 0.0 or 1000.0) bypass intended constraints and create pathological partitioning that degrades consensus performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Determinism Violation] Since union-find results are noted as non-deterministic, can this cause different validators to produce different partitions for the same block, breaking consensus safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Registry Collision] Can hash collisions in set_idx_registry cause different union-find sets to map to the same set_idx, merging unrelated transaction groups and violating conflict isolation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [ConnectedComponent Implementation] [Integer Wrapping] If num_chunks calculation in div_ceil overflows, can this cause incorrect chunking that violates the group size limit invariant? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [UniformPartitioner Implementation] [Modulo Edge Case] When num_txns % num_chunks calculation is performed, can integer overflow in the modulo operation cause incorrect big chunk counting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [UniformPartitioner Implementation] [Chunk Boundary] Can off-by-one errors in next_chunk_start/next_chunk_end calculations cause transaction indices to be duplicated or skipped across chunk boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [UniformPartitioner Implementation] [Empty Block] If num_txns is 0, will the uniform partitioner return empty vectors that cause null pointer exceptions in downstream processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [UniformPartitioner Implementation] [Shard Mismatch] Can num_shards exceeding num_txns cause empty shards or incorrect start_txn_idxs_by_shard values that break partition state assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [PartitionState Access] [Race Conditions] Can concurrent access to state.sender_idxs, state.read_sets, or state.write_sets through RwLock cause data races if PrePartitioner implementations incorrectly acquire write locks? (High)
